results.title: Maori moods and melodies
results.creator_credit: Robert Steele, Neuline Film Productions and New Zealand. Government Tourist Bureau
results.brief_description: New Zealand, home of the Maori people; steaming geysers, bubbling mud and dense forests; snow-lined mountains and turbulent water falls; the fine art of carving; and dancing.

results.title: Maori
results.creator_credit: New Zealand. Ministry of Foreign Affairs
results.brief_description: Discusses the Maori population in New Zealand and describes their customs, traditions and spiritual beliefs. Also makes reference to employment opportunities as well as social problems, experienced by Maoris. Contrasts modern New Zealand society with traditional Maori culture.

results.title: Manx myths & fairy tales
results.creator_credit: Caroline Webster, Julie Harmer, Queen Elizabeth II High School and Singer and Friedlander
results.brief_description: The Isle of Man is located in the centre of the British Isles. With their strong Celtic influences, the Isle has a strong tradition of storytelling, some similar to other stories from Celtic lands, some unique to the Isle itself. Narrated by Manx students Ben and Sarah, and told by Manx residents, these ten tales capture the essence of Celtic history. Each story is introduced, their origins explained, and then told accompanied by illustrations provided by Manx students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Caroline Webster, Julie Harmer, Queen Elizabeth II High School and Singer and Friedlander

results.title: Manas: a beautiful sanctuary in Assam
results.brief_description: A game sanctuary near the Bhutan border, and the many creatures it protects. Deer, elephants, rhino, buffaloes etc and a rare new species of golden langur discovered in the course of making this film.

results.title: Managing your time effectively
results.brief_description: Presented by Dr. Adrian Geering and designed to assist staff in clarifying their responsibilities and effectively delegating work. Demonstrates organisational strategies to maximise productivity from available time.

results.title: Managing disobedient behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.2. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand what disobedient behaviour is, why it occurs, how to prevent such behaviour, how to deal with disobedience which has become a regular behaviour pattern and how to manage disobedient behaviour crises. Accompanied by 45p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Managing aggressive behaviour
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and New England Educational Diagnostic Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Managing difficult behaviours”.
Module 3.1. Designed to assist the intellectual disability residential care worker to understand why aggressive behaviour occurs, learn how to “get in first” to avoid aggressive outbursts and how to deal systematically with particular forms of aggressive behaviour that have become a regular behaviour pattern. Accompanied by 48p. in-service training manual.
